result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry C. Lokken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Misconduct/Office-Act/Excess Authority, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.12(2).
  • Misconduct/Office-Act/Excess Authority, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.12(2).
  • Misconduct/Office-Act/Excess Authority, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.12(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Joint and Several with co-defendant
plus 10% restitution surcharge.
Remaining restitution requested by State of $29,740.70 to be discussed by counsel.  If no agreement, Restitution Hearing will be scheduled
Cash bond ordered forfeited and applied towards restitution
Count 2, 5 years Prison Imposed and Stayed ~ Condition of Probation:  Restitution joint and several to be paid in full within 4.5 years.

05-10-2016:  Court orders additional restitution of $56,088.70 ($29.740.70 forensic audit, $25,000.00 insurance deductible, and $1,348.00 misc costs) joint and several with co-defendant.
Employment only as approved by Probation Agent

No contact with co-defendant, K.O.
Not to leave State of Wisconsin during probation or extended supervision term

Pay costs of supervision
Provide DNA sample and pay fee
Programming, counseling and treatment per agent

records.descr: Pet mod bifurcated sent denied-not public interest

records.addlTxt:
Denying Motion to Modify Bifurcated Sentence.
It is hereby ordered: The defendant's Motion to Modify Bifurcated Sentence, filed May 10, 2021, is dismissed.
Letter dated 8/25/21 from Susan Barquist to the Court re: the Defendant's request for geriatric release.

(Case called at 01:46 PM-all parties for this hearing appear via Zoom) Defendant Larry C. Lokken appears by video from Thompson Correctional Center. Assistant District Attorney Angela Beranek appears by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's petition to modify bifurcated sentence. Defendant indicates that his counsel is no longer able to represent him. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to an attorney. At the Courts' request, State gives input on Defendant's waiver of right to an attorney. Court finds the Defendant has not waived his right to an attorney intelligently, knowingly, and freely. Court orders that counsel is to be appointed to the Defendant once he applies or the Defendant may hire his own attorney before further proceedings will be scheduled. Victim/Witness statute complied with.
Dated 08/10/2021 from John W. Torgerson to Court regarding letter of suppport for the defendant's release, i.e. Geriatric Release Petition.
Dated 08/05/2021, Letter from Corporation Counsel Tim Sullivan to Court regarding Defendant's petition for geriatric early release.
Dated 08/06/2021, Letter from ADA Beranek to Court regarding State's position opposing sentence modification.
Dated: 7-24-21 from Jan Steiner to Court regarding their oppostion for the early release request made by the defendant.
Letter Dated 7/18/21 from Richard Hanson to the Court requesting the Court uphold the imposed sentence.
Letter dated 6/21/21 from Richard Hanson to Court requesting the Court uphold the imposed sentence.
Dated 06/02/2021 from Rebecca Noland to Court regarding request for the Court to deny the defendant's petition for geriatric early release.
